required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Preference for Clarinex Tablets vs. Zyrtec Tablets in Patients With Allergies (P03180)
clinical_study.official_title: Preference Evaluation of Clarinex Tablets vs. Zyrtec Tablets in Subjects With Symptomatic Allergic Rhinitis

brief_summary.textblock: This was a crossover study designed to see if patients with allergy symptoms preferred Clarinex® or Zyrtec®. Patients were randomized to take 7 days of Clarinex or Zyrtec treatment, followed by a 5 to 28-day washout period (days when no drug is given), followed by 7 days of the opposite treatment. At the end of each 7-day treatment, patients were asked questions to determine which drug, Clarinex or Zyrtec, the patient prefers more.

primary_outcome.measure: The primary efficacy measure was the preference rates calculated from subject comparative evaluation.
primary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day after the last treatment period (Visit 5)

secondary_outcome.measure: Subject Non-Comparative Evaluation and subject Response to Therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 day after the end of each 7-day treatment period (Visit 3 and Visit 5)

arm_group.description: Clarinex 5 mg by mouth daily for 7 days followed by Zyrtec 10 mg by mouth daily for 7 days, with 5-28 days washout between treatments.
Zyrtec 10 mg by mouth daily for 7 days followed by Clarinex 5 mg by mouth daily for 7 days, with 5-28 days washout between treatments.
